genderPerspectives.title: Gender Perspectives
genderPerspectives.subtitle: Understanding how gender shapes experiences, opportunities, and challenges in society

whatIs.title: What is a Gender Perspective?
whatIs.description: A gender perspective examines how gender norms, roles, and relations affect individuals and communities differently. It helps identify inequalities and develop solutions that work for everyone.
whatIs.point1: Recognizes that women, men, and non-binary individuals have different experiences and needs
whatIs.point2: Examines how policies and practices affect genders differently
whatIs.point3: Promotes equal rights, responsibilities, and opportunities for all

genderSensitivity.title: Gender Sensitivity
genderSensitivity.subtitle: Learning to recognize and respond to the different needs and experiences of all genders

whatIs.title: What is Gender Sensitivity?
whatIs.description: Gender sensitivity means being aware of how gender affects people's lives and treating everyone with equal respect. It involves understanding stereotypes, avoiding bias, and creating inclusive environments.

language.title: Inclusive Language
language.description: Using words that respect and include all genders

inclusion.title: Equal Inclusion
inclusion.description: Ensuring everyone has equal opportunities to participate

respect.title: Respect & Dignity
respect.description: Treating all individuals with equal respect
respect.example1: Listen to all voices equally in discussions
respect.example2: Avoid dismissing concerns based on gender

awareness.title: Stereotype Awareness
awareness.example1: Don't assume roles based on gender
awareness.example2: Encourage children to pursue any interest

dos.title: Do's
dos.item1: Listen to and validate everyone's experiences
dos.item3: Challenge stereotypes when you see them

donts.title: Don'ts
donts.item1: Make assumptions based on someone's gender
donts.item3: Interrupt or talk over women in conversations
donts.item4: Assign roles based on gender stereotypes

cta.message: Small changes in awareness create big impacts
cta.subtext: Being gender-sensitive helps create safer, more inclusive communities for everyone

talkingToKids.title: Talking to Kids About Gender
talkingToKids.subtitle: Age-appropriate ways to discuss gender equality, stereotypes, and respect with children

whyImportant.title: Why These Conversations Matter
whyImportant.description: Children learn gender roles from an early age. Open conversations help them develop respect for all people and resist harmful stereotypes.
whyImportant.point1: Children absorb gender stereotypes by age 3-4
whyImportant.point2: Early education prevents discrimination and bullying
whyImportant.point3: Builds empathy and respect for others

young.title: Young Children
young.tip1: Use stories with diverse characters in different roles
young.tip2: Let them choose toys and activities freely
young.tip3: Teach that all feelings are okay for everyone

middle.title: School-Age Children
middle.tip1: Discuss stereotypes they see in media
middle.tip2: Talk about fairness and equal treatment

teen.title: Teenagers
teen.tip2: Talk about gender inequality in society
teen.tip3: Encourage them to speak up against discrimination

message1.title: Everyone deserves respect
message1.example: We treat everyone kindly, no matter if they're a boy, girl, or identify differently

message2.title: Abilities aren't determined by gender
message2.example: Anyone can be a doctor, teacher, or athlete - it's about what you love and work hard at

message3.title: Feelings are for everyone
message3.example: It's okay for boys to cry and girls to be strong - all feelings are valid

message4.title: Stand up for others
message4.example: If you see someone being treated unfairly because of their gender, speak up or tell an adult

starters.title: Conversation Starters
starters.starter1: What do you think it means when someone says 'that's for boys' or 'that's for girls'?
starters.starter2: Have you ever felt you couldn't do something because of being a boy/girl?
starters.starter3: What would you do if someone told your friend they couldn't play because of their gender?

control.title: Jealousy & Possessiveness
control.sign2: Controls what you wear or who you see
control.sign3: Gets angry when you spend time with others

anger.title: Unpredictable Anger
anger.sign2: Threats toward you or your loved ones

safetyTips.title: Safety Tips
safetyTips.tip1: Confide in trusted friends or family members
safetyTips.tip2: Develop a code word to signal you need help
safetyTips.tip3: Keep a charged phone with emergency numbers
safetyTips.tip4: Plan an escape route and safe place to go
safetyTips.tip5: Keep important documents in a safe place
